Name: Marble Bust of Serapis
Description: The white marble bust of Serapis wears the kalathos, or "sacred basket of mysteries" on his head. His head and beard are covered with thick curly hair, while five locks fall on his forehead. On the face, there are traces of gilding. Found at the Serapeum of Alexandria, perhaps Serapis is depicted with the same iconography as the famous cult statue sculpted by Pryaxis, a great sculptor, which was placed in the interior of the Serapeum.
